intro: Peucedanum calcareum, commonly known as the limestone angelica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves with finely divided lobes. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal gardens.
